{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the provided documents, there is evidence to suggest that a significant number of colorectal cancers may be due to missed adenomas. Document [0] states that assuming these cancers developed from an adenoma, only 1.3% of cancers were missed in the adenoma phase. Document [1] estimates that 0.7 per 1000 persons undergoing a screening colonoscopy had a cancer missed at the baseline colonoscopy, and an additional 1.1 per 1000 subsequently developed cancer from a missed adenoma. Document [4] also suggests that missed or incompletely removed adenomas at prior colonoscopies may contribute to the diagnosis of colorectal cancer.
